intro: Crocodeilanthe melanostele, commonly known as the black-stemmed hoya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements, it is a popular choice for indoor gardening.
